lead_paragraph: Report Offers Conflicting Signals on the Recession The economy shrank much more this summer than the government initially estimated, the Commerce Department said. The revised report offered conflicting signals about how long the current recession would last. In the third quarter, the economy contracted at an annual inflation-adjusted rate of 1.1 percent, its worst showing since 1991, during the nation's last recession. The government had originally reported a 0.4 percent decline, but new data led to the steeper drop reported in the scheduled revision. [Page C4.]
